channel.title: Posts on Master Pi
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Master Pi

item.title: What This Blog Is All About
item.description: Some first words The Journey, my blog, is a story book of mine which is about all aspects in my life, and knowledge I learned in life of living (I’m not sure about that, my life is quite boring). Why I name my site “The Journey”? Good question. I don’t know, too. I feel it is catchy. But blogging is not the main target of this site. I have a bad memory, so writing things down is the best way to store it, and maybe it could be helpful for some people.

item.title: How to Make Your Trackpad Like Macbook
item.description: If you used Mac products before, I bet the only thing you will never forget is its multi-touch trackpad. Its convenience can improve the work performance a lot, and it even made me feel confused when using other products’s trackpad. Luckily, when you say “Linux”, you are talking about the “Open Sources”, and there are some drivers that support it, like mtrack. In this blog, we will dive into how we can make our trackpad as close to Mac experience as we can get with mtrack.

item.title: How to Make a Github Blog
item.description: Hi, this is my way to make a Github blog for my self, which will contain blogs, some projects, and some tips from my experience. I am a webasite newbie, so it took me almost 2 days to setup from start to finish, and it’s pretty easy. Here is how I made it. Initial setup Create repositories First, let take a look at what a Github Page is, and how to create one.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: Markdown Examples
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
